p: Several diagnostic tests for the detection of antibodies to MCF viruses have been described [ 11]. These assays use AlHV-1 as the antigen since this virus can be propagated in vitro [ 11] . Serological tests used to identify AlHV-1 infection include indirect ELISA [ 12, 13], competitive inhibition (CI)- ELISA [ 14â€“ 16], virus neutralization test (VNT) [ 12, 17] and indirect fluorescent antibody test [ 18]. The indirect ELISA depends on a polyclonal response, which may be more robust in detecting sick animals with partial or low antibody titres compared with the CI-ELISA [ 13]. In MCF-susceptible hosts like cattle, no virus-neutralizing antibody response is induced, hence antibodies are detected using ELISA, indirect immunofluorescence or Western blot [ 10].
